summary.purpose: Defines the main Table component, the TableProvider context wrapper, and the TableContext used to share table state (search, sort, filter, pagination) among all sub-components.
summary.problem_solved: Provides a fully-featured, configurable data table with built-in search (with debounced multi-term '+' syntax), column sorting, column filtering, export-to-Excel support, row-count limiting, summary rows, and deep-equal memoisation via React.memo to avoid unnecessary re-renders.

external.why_used: React core for hooks (createContext, useMemo, useRef, useState, useContext, useEffect) and component composition.
external.name: react

external.why_used: Used for isEqual() deep equality comparison in React.memo for optimized re-render prevention.
external.name: lodash

external.why_used: Provides cn() utility for conditional CSS class composition throughout the component.
external.name: @/lib/utils

exports.name: TableContext
exports.description_one_line: React context holding merged table configuration and state for all sub-components.

exports.name: TableProvider
exports.description_one_line: Context provider that initializes all table state hooks and manages filtered/sorted/paginated data rendering.

exports.name: Table
exports.description_one_line: Memoized table component with deep equality comparison preventing re-renders from immutable prop changes.

symbols.name: TableContext
symbols.description: React Context instance that holds the merged table state combining TableProps configuration and TableProviderType state management. All table sub-components (TableHead, TableBody, Search, ExportToExcel, etc.) consume this context via the useTableContext hook to access shared state and handlers.
symbols.description_one_line: React context holding merged table configuration and state for all sub-components.

details.what_it_does: Created with React.createContext, initialized with null default, and populated by TableProvider. Contains all table configuration props (data, headers, maxRows, styling options) plus computed state (filters, sortColumn, searchQuery, dataToRender) and state handlers (handleSort, handleSearch, handleFilterChange). Enables descendant components to access table state without prop drilling.

minimal_correct.title: Accessing TableContext in a sub-component

extensive_correct.title: Using context state for conditional rendering

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Not checking for null context

symbols.name: TableProvider
symbols.description: Internal context provider component that orchestrates all table state management. Initializes six custom hooks (useSort, useDisplayToggle, useSearch, useFilter) to manage sort, pagination, search, and filtering state. Computes the final filtered/sorted/paginated dataToRender and provides all state plus handlers via TableContext.Provider to child components. Wraps children in a flex-column container with optional gap spacing and direction support.
symbols.description_one_line: Context provider that initializes all table state hooks and manages filtered/sorted/paginated data rendering.

details.what_it_does: Extracts all props with defaults, initializes state via hooks: useSort (manages sortColumn, sortOrder), useDisplayToggle (displayAllRows), useSearch (searchQuery, debouncedSearchQuery), useFilter (filters, filterPopupsDisplay). Computes allKeys from data to enable cross-column search. Applies multi-term search (split by '+', all terms AND'd), then filtering (values per column AND'd), then sorting (by sortKeys index). Paginated with maxRows unless displayAllRows=true. Returns all state in providerValues object. Renders flex-column div with optional gap and direction, wrapping context provider.
details.rendered_ui_description: Renders a flex-column container (display:flex, flex-direction:column, width:100%, height:100%) with optional gap-2 spacing when toolbar elements are present (includeSearch, exportToExcelKeys, showDisplayAllRowsButton, optionalElement). Supports RTL/LTR via CSS direction property. Children are rendered wrapped in TableContext.Provider.

params.name: data
params.description: Array of data objects to render in table rows. Each object's keys become accessible columns.

params.name: headers
params.description: Array of header display strings matching table columns (length should match keysToRender).

params.name: keysToRender
params.description: Array of object keys (from data items) to render as visible columns. Order determines column sequence.

params.name: includeSearch
params.description: When true, renders search input toolbar. Enables debounced multi-term search with '+' syntax (e.g., 'john+admin' searches for rows containing both 'john' AND 'admin').

params.name: noneSearchKeys
params.description: Array of data keys to exclude from search. Useful for ID fields or computed columns that shouldn't be searchable.

params.name: autoFocus
params.description: Whether search input should auto-focus when rendered.

params.name: searchPlaceHolder
params.description: Placeholder text for search input.

params.name: sortKeys
params.description: Array of sortable column keys. Must match keysToRender order. Undefined key index means column is not sortable.

params.name: sortLabel
params.description: Label text for sort selector.

params.name: filterableColumns
params.type: { header: string; dataKey: string; ui?: (value: any) => ReactNode }[]
params.description: Array of columns with filtering enabled. Each entry specifies header display text, dataKey to filter, and optional ui function to format filter option display.

params.name: filterLabel
params.description: Label text for filter selectors.

params.name: exportToExcelKeys
params.description: When provided, renders export-to-Excel button. Specifies which keys to include in Excel export.

params.name: excelFileName
params.description: File name (without .xlsx) for exported Excel file.

params.name: excelHeadline
params.description: Title row to include in Excel export.

params.name: exportExcelContent
params.description: Custom content to include in Excel export.

params.name: dataToAddToExcelTable
params.type: { key: string; value: any; header: string }[]
params.description: Additional rows to append to Excel export (for summary rows, notes, etc.).

params.name: sumColumns
params.type: { label: string; dataKey: string; ui?: (value: any) => ReactNode }[]
params.description: When provided, renders summary footer showing sum/totals for specified columns.

params.name: maxRows
params.description: Maximum rows to display per page. When exceeded, pagination controls appear unless displayAllRows is toggled.

params.name: maxRowsLabel1
params.description: Text before row count in max-rows label (e.g., 'Showing').

params.name: maxRowsLabel2
params.description: Text after row count in max-rows label (e.g., 'of 500').

params.name: showDisplayAllRowsButton
params.description: When true, shows toggle button to display all rows (overriding maxRows limit).

params.name: displayAllRowsButtonLabel
params.description: Label text for display-all-rows toggle button.

params.name: optionalElement
params.description: Custom React element to render in toolbar next to search/export controls.

params.name: containerStyle
params.description: Inline styles applied to main container div.

params.name: containerClassName
params.description: CSS class names applied to main container div.

params.name: containerHeaderClassName
params.description: CSS classes for toolbar header row.

params.name: searchInputClassName
params.description: CSS classes for search input element.

params.name: searchInputStyle
params.description: Inline styles for search input.

params.name: searchContainerClassName
params.description: CSS classes for container wrapping search and export controls.

params.name: tableContainerClass
params.description: CSS classes for scrollable table wrapper (overflow-y-auto container).

params.name: tableContainerStyle
params.description: Inline styles for scrollable table container.

params.name: tableStyle
params.description: Inline styles for <table> element.

params.name: tableBodyClassName
params.description: CSS classes for <tbody> element.

params.name: headerStyle
params.description: Inline styles for <thead> or header row.

params.name: headerClassName
params.description: CSS classes for header row.

params.name: headerCellStyle
params.description: Inline styles for <th> cells.

params.name: headerCellClassName
params.description: CSS classes for <th> cells.

params.name: rowStyles
params.description: Inline styles for data <tr> rows.

params.name: rowClassName
params.description: Base CSS classes for data <tr> rows.

params.name: rowClassNameFunction
params.description: Function returning dynamic CSS classes based on row data. Called for each row.

params.name: cellStyle
params.description: Inline styles for <td> cells.

params.name: cellClassName
params.description: CSS classes for <td> cells.

params.name: zebraStriping
params.description: Classes to alternate between odd/even rows for visual striping effect.

params.name: selectedRow
params.type: { className?: string; rowIndex?: number | null; onChange?: (rowIndex: number) => void }
params.description: Configuration for row selection highlighting and onChange callback.

params.name: onRowClick
params.description: Callback fired when a row is clicked. Receives the row's data object and zero-indexed row position.

params.name: direction
params.description: Text direction: 'ltr' (left-to-right) or 'rtl' (right-to-left) for Arabic, Hebrew, Persian layouts.

params.name: children
params.description: Child components to render within the table context provider.

returns.description: A flex-column div wrapper providing TableContext to all descendant components.

minimal_correct.title: Basic table with data and headers

extensive_correct.title: Fully-featured table with search, filtering, sorting, export, and pagination

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Mismatched headers/keysToRender lengths

symbols.name: Table
symbols.description: The primary exported table component, a React.memo wrapper around TableBase with deep equality comparison via lodash isEqual. Prevents unnecessary re-renders when table props haven't meaningfully changed. Composed of TableProvider (state orchestration) and TableBase (UI layout). Accepts all TableProps and provides a fully-featured configurable data table with search, filtering, sorting, pagination, and export capabilities. Props are compared deeply, so even if the data array reference changes but content is identical, the component won't re-render.
symbols.description_one_line: Memoized table component with deep equality comparison preventing re-renders from immutable prop changes.

details.what_it_does: Wraps TableBase with React.memo using areEqual custom comparison. The areEqual function uses lodash isEqual to perform deep structural comparison of all TableProps, enabling the component to skip re-renders when props are deeply equal but may have different object references (e.g., new data array with identical contents). This is a critical optimization for large tables or tables in parent components that re-render frequently. Sets displayName='Table' for debugging.
details.rendered_ui_description: Renders the complete table UI: flex-column container with optional toolbar (search input, export button, pagination controls), scrollable table region with sticky header and rows, optional summary footer. All sub-components consume TableContext for shared state.

params.name: props
params.description: Complete table configuration object including data, headers, keysToRender, styling, behavior options (search, sort, filter, pagination, export, summary). See TableProps interface for 40+ properties.

returns.description: React element rendering the complete memoized table with all features.

minimal_correct.title: Basic table rendering with required props

extensive_correct.title: Production table with advanced features and memoization benefits

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Creating new objects on every render breaks memoization

known_gaps: The import of TableSCN from '../ui/table' is present but not visibly used in the Table.tsx file — it may be used in the sub-components (TableHead, TableBody, etc.) or is a leftover import.
The import of textNumbersRegex from helpers/forms is imported but not visibly used in this file — may be used in sub-components or search logic.
quality.documentation_completeness: Comprehensive: All 3 exported symbols (TableContext, TableProvider, Table) fully documented with complete prop signatures (40+ props for TableProvider), detailed behavior explanations, and 3-tier examples (minimal, extensive, incorrect). TableContext provides deep context access documentation. TableProvider documents all state management, search/filter/sort/pagination behavior. Table explains memoization strategy and re-render prevention. All examples use real-world scenarios with production patterns.
